tool_description: The AWS GuardDuty API enables real-time threat detection, automated response, and custom integrations to enhance the security of your AWS accounts.
name: Amazon Web Services (AWS) GuardDuty Detector
title: Amazon Web Services (AWS) GuardDuty Detector

api_list.name: /detector/{detectorId}
api_list.description: This operation enables users to update and modify the configuration of a specific detector identified by its detectorId. By providing the detectorId as a parameter in the request to this endpoint, users can make changes to various properties of the detector, such as alert thresholds, monitoring rules, or other relevant settings.

api_list.name: /detector
api_list.description: This operation enables the creation of a new detector resource. By using this endpoint, users can set up a detector instance to monitor and detect potential threats within their system.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://amazon-web-services-aws-guardduty-detector.p.rapidapi.com/detector"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "amazon-web-services-aws-guardduty-detector.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://amazon-web-services-aws-guardduty-detector.p.rapidapi.com/detector"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "amazon-web-services-aws-guardduty-detector.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
